content: Seriously @Enbridge: You start w/ @tech_mahindra, not the best choice. Then you want someone w/ 12-20 years of overall experience in critical infrastructure @ $65/hr on #H1B. This screams substandard. Is #Enbridge that desperate for cheap labor? Go for #quality & #competence. https://t.co/D2ZxgakdRj

The use of hard-coded credentials in systems is idiotic at best & criminal at worst. Chirp Systems & their parent company @RealPage obviously didn‚Äôt get that memo. Now @CISAgov assigned the flaw a 9.1 #CVSS. HT @briankrebs. https://t.co/R7nCnbcW1y
@stiennon New year, new Yearbook. Looking forward to reading it. üìö

@0xMatt @aschmelyun @Airbnb Typical #scammer MO. They want you to work outside of the platform where they can get a lot more personal information. And where you also lack all of the protections and indemnifications that the platform offers. Most people are oblivious to that and get scammed.

There is a lots of histrionics about #Iran & #Israel from #CNN, #FoxNews & others. Here are some insights from a friend in Jerusalem that sets the record straight. And it's 100% accurate. @CNN would love things to escalate for better ratings. Sorry CNN. https://t.co/pOrG7gTn05

A #LastPass employee was targeted with #deepfake calls. I‚Äôd assume everyone from @Okta, @keepersecurity, @pingidentity to @Microsoft & more are targets in these #phishing attacks.
HT @IonutArghire in @securityweek. https://t.co/IltfBylxmF
RT @JFrgatUCLA: Amid rising antisemitism, the Jewish Faculty Resilience Group JFrg at #UCLA stands as a beacon of hope üïäÔ∏è. Their unwavering‚Ä¶

Cybersecurity researchers at @sucurisecurity discovered credit card skimmer that's concealed within a fake Meta Pixel tracker script in an attempt to evade detection. #WordPress &  #MageCart are huge targets. Great way to ruin #PCI compliance. HT @jbhall56 https://t.co/UgFnRWwqkL

XZ backdoor could‚Äôve been a huge #infosec disaster, but was narrowly averted. This @xygeni piece details how #XZ backdoor was injected.  Writes how difficult it is to detect intentional backdoors & that backdoors should be considered an internal threat. https://t.co/840WG3SRsr

According to @ISACANews, Continuous Security Validation (CSV) allows an organization to take cyber attackers‚Äô perspective & stress-test its security stance. @PicusSecurity is offering a free course on #CSV fundamentals to help validate & improve #infosec.  https://t.co/9dEuCaOEjD

A #Microsoft researcher found malicious code in #XZUtils. Now #CVE20243094 is 10/10 #CVSS. @Zur_Ulianitzky of @XMCyber_ notes that the vulnerability is only present in pre-release versions, so there is no patch. So revert to previous, unaffected versions. https://t.co/9YYmnmACQW

Many job seekers change their LinkedIn status to #OpenToWork. That won‚Äôt get them a job, but opens them up to scammers looking to capitalize on their often desperate hunt for a new job. Scammers use that to trick #LinkedIn members. Don‚Äôt be a #scam victim. https://t.co/dg2SbzTR9s

Good overview by @ThomasSegura13 of @GitGuardian of the #xzUtils open-source backdoor that almost compromised #SSH & would have wreaked havoc. It underscores the importance of  open-source software monitoring. Which to date, has been heavily  overlooked. https://t.co/uS9kvz2Rvk

My @RSAConference book of the month review: Confident Cyber Security: The Essential Insights and How to Protect from Threats, by @drjessicabarker, published by @KoganPage. A great introduction to #infosec & a very readable book. https://t.co/tAbW2nOUWq

I shared a story of a @PerceptionPo1nt security researcher about attacks  against @bookingcom. And then discovered an entire industry of  #bookingcom scammers exploiting people needing help. Victims will have  their bank accounts drained afterward. https://t.co/V48N81o3as #scam

A #Microsoft researcher found malicious code in #XZUtils. Now #CVE20243094 is 10/10 #CVSS. @Zur_Ulianitzky of @XMCyber_ notes that the vulnerability is only present in pre-release versions,  so there is no patch. So revert to previous, unaffected versions. https://t.co/9YYmnmACQW

If you store #data in the #EU, the @EU_Commission Cyber Resilience Act (CRA) is a huge regulation you must contend with. Once approved, you have 36 short months to adapt to new requirements. The time to start planning is now. HT Jonatan Bodo of @BugProve. https://t.co/8RLkChcWQc

I shared a story of a @PerceptionPo1nt #infosec researcher on attacks against @bookingcom & then discovered an entire industry of #bookingcom scammers exploiting people needing help. Identity theft #scam has victims' bank accounts drained & zero recourse. https://t.co/V48N81o3as

Email is the backbone of business communications, and yet email is also one of the most common attack vectors for cyber threats. Some good ideas by @RealTonyBradley where he suggests a strategic overhaul of email security postures is needed. https://t.co/GDGMJ6gJDr #infosec

Here‚Äôs how conspiracy theories start: What if it was #Microsoft who placed the backdoor in #Debian & #RedHat? @AndresFreundTec of @Microsoft found it & now it makes #OpenSource suspect. Open source is full of rogue actors. But Microsoft is safe & secure. https://t.co/oyspHnofQG

@mdkail @elonmusk I shared a story of research by Elad Damari from Perception Point about attacks against Bookingcom. I was then bombarded by Bookingcom scammers. The sad thing is lots of people fall for it and lose money w/ no recourse from law enforcement.
https://t.co/V48N81nvkU

#Deepfake cyberattacks, #phishing & social engineering have all received a turbo boost in recent months due to the proliferation of easily accessed #AI tools. Really good piece by Bojan Simic of @HyprCorp on ways to put kibosh on those #infosec attacks. https://t.co/YC6mOZNsAm

@DBashIdeas Indeed, an amazing sefer. You might be a bit optimistic when you write anti-Zionists would gain a tremendous amount from it. They generally are so enmeshed in the bias that all the logic & superb writing in the world won‚Äôt change their prejudiced minds. https://t.co/l45bFlIf1O

Attackers target hotels & gain https://t.co/7gke6kuT2s credentials. Research by Elad Damari of @PerceptionPo1nt shows how attackers are impersonating @bookingcom & execute malicious payloads. Massive amounts of customer data can be breached. https://t.co/36FDOI8Iq0

FYI @garyleff: Attackers target hotels to gain https://t.co/7gke6kuT2s credentials. Research by Elad Damari @PerceptionPo1nt shows how attackers are impersonating @bookingcom to execute malicious payloads. Massive amounts of customer data can be breached. https://t.co/oqQK4GmDM9
@SwiftOnSecurity @shehackspurple That‚Äôs what they said. More likely they got it from a site like @ZoomInfo that sells that business information.

Okta is vulnerable & a prime target. Eli Guy of @XMCyber_ explores tactics employed by red teams to gain entry into a #Okta environment. He shows how attackers use the Okta RBAC module to elevate privileges & move laterally within the @Okta infrastructure. https://t.co/TVHEvjXQB2

When people hear #Nigeria, they think #scam. It's ironic that @PoliceNG @PoliceNG_CRU who have been bribed in the past & let cybercriminals go free, have arrested a pregnant woman for posting a negative tomato puree review. HT @princewill_nimi in @CNN. https://t.co/f3TwEf2YGq
@DBashIdeas @thevoos Shiurei Da'as, by Rav Bloch ztzl.

@thevoos @DBashIdeas Was at gvirs house on Purim & met her great-grandson who was collecting for Telz Riverdale. Told baal ha‚Äôbayis that R‚Äô Gifter ainikel was there. He said, if you go to my otzer & find the only Telzer sefer I have, I‚Äôll give you an extra check. He came back a minute later with it.

@mckeay @jaysonstreet Maybe the lesson he‚Äôs trying to teach us is what Alphaville sang, to stay forever young.

https://t.co/MXjljIYdQg

The @NSAGov & @CISAgov released its top 10 cloud security mitigation strategies to make cloud environments more secure. @ShelleyLeveson of @HyprCorp provides highlights of the guidance and what you can do to make your #cloud usage more secure. https://t.co/gFWdQ0rk9c #NSA

You can goodbye to #privacy & honesty on #Glassdoor as they‚Äôre adding real names w/o user consent. @Glassdoor prided itself on #anonymity, now it consults public sources to identify users. #Anonymity thing of the past. https://t.co/xqCi276b5Y. HT @ashleynbelanger in @arstechnica.

#PhantomBlu is a sophisticated malware campaign targeting US-based firms. The #malware employs new TTPs & behaviors to evade detection & deploys #NetSupport RAT. It exploits legitimate features of remote admin tools. HT Ariel Davidpur of @PerceptionPo1nt. https://t.co/XcDkBimJcr

Say goodbye to #privacy on #Glassdoor as they‚Äôre adding real names w/o user consent. @Glassdoor now consults public sources to identify users. #Anonymity was a major selling point of the site. No more. 
https://t.co/xqCi275Dgq. HT @ashleynbelanger in @arstechnica.

From @KarstenChearis of @xmcyber_: The 3 Big Questions CISOs Ask Themselves. He took the questions from the #CISO & categorized them into three challenges. Important one deals w/   communications w/ board members & executive leadership. https://t.co/YSDn68mpNs #infosec #CSO #CISO

Free breach & attack simulation course from @PicusSecurity.  By the end, understand differences between vulnerability scanning, pen  testing, red teaming & continuous security validation approaches,  and building blocks of breach & attack simulation (BAS). https://t.co/IKpW3ld18l

Informative @gitguardian breach breakdown video detailing nation-state attack on @Microsoft by Russian-backed hacking group #MidnightBlizzard AKA #NOBELIUM between November 2023 & March 2024. If #Microsoft can be breached, so can most firms. https://t.co/ZqZIQRiAID #infosec

In case you missed the obituary, Triple DES died. As @NIST withdrew it 12/31/23. @jbhall56 writes #PCI #DSS implications are significant. It means you need to immediately migrate to #AES as #3DES no longer meets the PCI definition of ‚Äústrong‚Äù cryptography. https://t.co/bfeV507uqj

In 2022 Kaiser Permanente suffered a #PHI data breach. In 2023, they mailed confidential data to wrong addresses. They certainly haven‚Äôt learned their lesson as they want a cybersecurity expert w/ many advanced #infosec skills, but @aboutKP only paying a junior consulting rate. https://t.co/p4M4GAGrlE

First, the #conspiracy #theory people were going wild over the Kate Middleton picture. Now a @Boeing whistleblower is found dead due to a self-inflicted gunshot wound. #Boeing certainly wanted him silenced. https://t.co/Begb6jJV0n  HT @Theothebald in @BBC

Got to love the title of this blog post from @AdaptiveShield. #Nobelium #APT29 & #MidnightBlizzard breached #Microsoft corporate email accounts for over a month. It‚Äôs not that even Microsoft Isn't perfect, they have never been close to perfect #infosec. https://t.co/5t0zjQznp4

My @RSAConference #infosecbook review: Fighting Phishing: Everything You Can Do to Fight Social Engineering & Phishing, by @rogeragrimesvia @WileyTech. #NorthKorea& #China investing in #phising. Invest in anti-phishing defenses to not be victim. #RSAC https://t.co/JDosKvueWf

#Coper, a descendant of #Exobot malware was distributed as a fake version of @Bancolombia Personas app. With keylogging & interception of push notifications, it‚Äôs quite dangerous. And it‚Äôs back. Criminal networks focusing on #Mobile #malware. HT @teamcymru https://t.co/yDv1Rap4pU

Very strategic acquisition by @CrowdStrike as they buy Israel based @flow_security for $200M.  This and similar acquisitions will only enhance #CrowdStrike. HT @assafgi in @GlobesEnglish

https://t.co/B1zPYPFi4q

Great @jaysonstreet interview by @McDwayne, where Jayson shares his story. He shares that #hacking is a lot more about using one‚Äôs innate curiosity, than just running tools. Lots of life lessons & practical advice for those looking to get into #infosec.  https://t.co/jGogvmeRZa

Really good piece by @lawndoc on @GitGuardian blog on the risks of storing secrets in mobile apps. Shows why client-side secrecy is impossible as #mobile #apps leak secrets. Details best practices for securing mobile app secrets & #infosec data protection. https://t.co/7nHkPoNCnJ

Have an #Amex card? @AmericanExpress was breached & advising customers to review their statements over next 12 to 24 months & report suspicious behavior. For customers, easier to just request new cards. HT @LawrenceAbrams in @bleepincomputer. https://t.co/6Sr9T8lJPg #Databreach
@hchesner Consider it a bargain. For the cost of a single Pesach vacation, get a historical siddur that will last a lifetime and can be passed down to future generations.

Attack Techniques in Okta Part 1: Deep dive into @Okta key terms.  Technical info by Eli Guy of @XMCyber_. If you use #Okta, important to be aware of the potential attack techniques attackers may try to leverage when targeting users & how to mitigate them. https://t.co/sL9Fopov69

@MalwareJake @Boeing @FAANews This video by @wendoverpro 'How @Boeing Lost Its Way' does a great job of explaining how #Boeing went from first to worst. They went from an engineering-first organization to one about making Wall Street first. With disastrous consequences. 
https://t.co/HeNy4HivLe

Really good analysis by @igorhsabino of @PhilosProject in @mosaicmag on Brazil's bizarre love of comparing things to the Holocaust. Written in 2021, prescient as to @LulaOficial recent comments comparing #Israel #Gaza war against #Hamas to the #Holocaust https://t.co/LGGWWEYYi0
@SecBarbie It‚Äôs like they use the Millennium Tower as a paradigm for #infosec design. https://t.co/rS8F1mi83c  #MillenniumTower

If you are going to the RSA Conference (AKA the greatest #infosec show on earth) in May, here are some tips I wrote up to maximize your conference experience. @RSAConference #RSAC

https://t.co/IsRhHD6nmS

@phat_hobbit @MalwareJake On the topic of #FUD in #infosec, here's a good piece from last week by @kevtownsend in @SecurityWeek. He writes that security pros could benefit from FUD awareness training like phishing awareness training for regular end-users.
https://t.co/bIQJ7S8eWU

Research by @proofpoint identified #Microsoft #Azure environment as #phishing targets. @rogeragrimes of @KnowBe4 just wrote a book on the topic & this by @AdaptiveShield  underscores the fact that firms often forget about securing their cloud environments. https://t.co/hcvWnYuoFJ

Hi @AirCanada: Bought 3 tickets. I‚Äôm @United Silver Elite. Both United & #AirCanada are @staralliance members. But after spending all that, I can‚Äôt believe I still need to pay for seat assignments so we can sit together. Can you waive that as a courtesy given cost of the tickets?

Finally, Signal is rolling out new settings today to let you create a username instead of revealing your phone number to everyone you communicate with. Probably the most requested feature in @signalapp 10-year history. HT @a_greenberg in @wired. https://t.co/HBtkPuS4QG

The healthcare industry has massive amounts of poorly secured #HIPAA #PII. #cybercriminals love #healthcare due to poor #infosec controls & inadequate #cybersecurity staff. And it‚Äôs not getting better anytime soon. HT @ThomasSegura13 of @GitGuardian https://t.co/730xR4UvOo

Really good analysis by @ThomasSegura13 & @McDwayne of @GitGuardian on how stolen @Okta authentication tokens led to the @Cloudflare breach. Breach illustrates the threat of secrets sprawl: sensitive data spread across many platforms w/o adequate #infosec. https://t.co/yM0IUvvqca

Really interesting free report by @PicusSecurity on top 10 most prevalent MITRE ATT&CK techniques. They  looked at over 600,000 #malware samples & assessed more than 7M million instances of #MITRE #ATT&CK techniques. #1 is malware tactic #hunter-killer. https://t.co/vX6HiDnn7Q

Security researcher @PsychoMario of @SnykSec found 4 critical container #infosec breakout vulns (#LeakyVessels) impacting core container tech including #Docker, #runc & related cloud infrastructure like #Kubernetes. Remediation needs to be done ASAP. https://t.co/AcDYrqwEfM

This by @XMCyber_ on how cyberinsurance must work better. #cyberinsurance has transformed from nice-to-have to a business essential. But must integrate exposure management into #infosec policies to reduce risk & drive smarter investments in #cybersecurity. https://t.co/Fqk1BV1kZ7

My @RSAConference book of the month review: Israel & the Cyber Threat: How the Startup Nation Became a Global Cyber Power. Details how #Israel became a world cyberpower & how they built up their sophisticated #cybersecurity strategy. Via @oxunipress. https://t.co/27rOS93G7J #RSAC

@grushkay The time when all airlines will use a passenger's #BMI for their ticket price is an inevitability. The profits in that pricing model are compelling for them. #Airlines can structure it such that passengers and regulators will be powerless to challenge it. https://t.co/HMWurIia9M

@RachelTobac Everything #FCC has done to stop #scam #robocalls has had minimal effect. They must use their powers & have the Indian government shut down #robocall centers. Until then, nothing will change. FCC must realize lawbreakers don‚Äôt follow their rulings. https://t.co/HppiKMyw68

@MalwareJake @AccidentalCISO How much did the hack affect #SolarWinds bottom line? Firms have huge sunk costs in a product & often unwilling to migrate off them, even after multiple breaches. People often have short memories when it comes to product purchases. I think #Ivanti will hurt, but will survive.

A security influencer has a program how to get a remote, 6-figure #cybersecurity job in 45 days.  An essential aspect of working in #infosec is critical thinking. One can best show that by not taking a course selling nothing but hope & empty promises. https://t.co/9qKFqjSC8m

While it doesn‚Äôt deal with #MeAt21, this piece by @AShiftan of @PrivacyPiiano details the rise in threats to personal data based on research from Dr. Stuart Madnick of @MIT & @Apple. Details escalating threats to #privacy due to cybercriminal activities. https://t.co/kAYWDJb8mX

The #SuperBowl is soon & online sportsbooks have ads everywhere. Think that you  can win back these ‚Äòbonus bets‚Äô? Nope: read the terms & conditions. #FanDuel #DraftKings #bet365& #BetMGMare making billions in #gambling profits off these gullible gamblers. https://t.co/MSPPNLL6Sr

#IANAL, but this has no chance of success, as @taylorswift13 using @VenableLLP to stop @Jxck_Sweeney from sharing public data. It might be creepy & border stalking, but no laws prohibit plane tracking activities. HT @justcalmajourno in @Verge https://t.co/VgwUZI4Hug #taylorswift
End of an era as Gil Shwed stepping down from CEO role at @CheckPointSW.  #CheckPoint might be the greatest #infosec firm of all time. https://t.co/bj0Sa4FqbG HT @GlobesEnglish

Top 2024 trend & prediction is navigating #infosec & #compliance. A big area is @SECGov control over #CISO. #SECis increasing scrutiny on C-suite executives. And #CSO could turn into: Chief Scapegoat Officer is #cybersecurity not implemented. HT @Ostendio https://t.co/UWrXr79NZT

Interesting @ronreiter of @sentra_security piece how ChatGPT is a data loss disaster. There‚Äôs many #ChatGPT #data #privacy concerns. #infosec tools needed to redact #PII & #PCI data from ChatGPT prompts. If not, will be significant #cybersecurity problems. https://t.co/D9tDkDRDtm
Hi @Change ‚Äì can you share a few significant real-world events where a Change petition made an actual difference and effected change? #Change.org Change #Changeorg
